channel.title: Comments on: Stupid me #4 â€“ The login is from an untrusted domain
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Koen Verbeeck
item.dc:creator: Koen Verbeeck
item.description:
Hi David,
thanks for letting me know!

item.title: By: David Robinson
item.dc:creator: David Robinson
item.description: This is a nice article, but I saw one grammatical error in the third paragraph where you've stated "but the AD admin ensured me". I think you meant to say "but the AD admin assured me". This is not a major flaw, and the article on the whole was very engaging. Thanks for the post!
item.content:encoded: This is a nice article, but I saw one grammatical error in the third paragraph where you’ve stated “but the AD admin ensured me”. I think you meant to say “but the AD admin assured me”. This is not a major flaw, and the article on the whole was very engaging. Thanks for the post!

item.title: By: Phil Lenoir
item.dc:creator: Phil Lenoir
item.description:
I've also had this error in two other contexts: 1) A laptop has been logged-on to while not connected to the domain using cached credentials and subsequently connected to the domain. for some reason file services were avaialable, but not a SQL Server connection! 2) Am intermittent problem from desktop connections where we think a transient network error has occurred or maybe a password was updated. We've never been able to find the cause as we can't replicate.
The solution in both cases was to log-out and back in again.
item.content:encoded:
I’ve also had this error in two other contexts:
1) A laptop has been logged-on to while not connected to the domain using cached credentials and subsequently connected to the domain. for some reason file services were avaialable, but not a SQL Server connection!
2) Am intermittent problem from desktop connections where we think a transient network error has occurred or maybe a password was updated. We’ve never been able to find the cause as we can’t replicate.

The solution in both cases was to log-out and back in again.
